column5: Can anyone tell if this is a chinny or a Coho salmon fry. Fish had a white mouth. Thanks.
Hmm...hard to say...found this image on the net....I'd say it looks closer to chinook though   When I read the thread, I thought you were frying them to eat....lol
Here's another shot of Coho fry that I found...
IDing juvenile salmonids is not easy... its not rocket science either. You usually have to use a key. The book "Fresh Water Fishes Of Canada" is very good. I'll try to dig mine out.
Did it roll or make straight runs when you were fighting it?  That'll tell you which it is.   heheh.  anal fin.  most likely a coho.
I'll say Chinook based on this key that I made up when I was in school. The key for adult salmons, trouts and chars is different than this one for juveniles 2-5 inches long.
Wow...that's pretty cool kickingfrog!!  Thanks for the insight!
Ya, I caught so many 4 inch salmon I had to make that key
